title: (x) "STEREO" from 1960s record sleeve - Hellenic Wide {Dav}
content:
Does anyone know what font is used here?  
Any help would be welcome. Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [stereo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=stereo.jpg) | 72.38 KB |
author: green_child

comments.content:
The letterforms in [58 Rodeo](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126084234/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/baselinefonts/58-rodeo/) but the serifs are square and not softly rounded.

Yes, I’m old, but I’m back in style!

‘Hellenic _( Wide )_’..

_( Ill quote myself.: ‘..If you are looking for a ‘Hellenic’ revival, like ‘58 Rodeo’, you may want to consider some of these.: ‘ [Antique Central](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126084234/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aboutype/antique-central/)’, ‘ [Antique Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126084234/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/archivetype/archive-antique-extended/)’, ‘ [Hefty](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126084234/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/hefty.htm)’, ‘ [HiFi Stereo](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126084234/http:/hem.passagen.se/spsweet/font2/stereo.html)’ ( Free ), ‘ [Platon](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126084234/http:/www.csaimages.com/results.asp?image=FNT018&wwwflag=&imagepos=18)’, and, ‘ [Zapata](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126084234/http:/www.letterror.com/foundry/zapata/index.html)’..’ )_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126084234/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Many thanks to both Norbert and Dav. Spot on!

The free font Stereo was actually quite nice.
